docs.title: Cookbook
docs.text:
Each recipe is a markdown file with three sections:

  1. Ingredients as shopping list with sections for:
    • Produce
    • Dairy
    • Middle
    • Staples - Check pantry
  2. Ingredients as a prep list
  3. Cooking instructions
  4. Notes (e.g., prep time)
  5. Citation

      • Entrees

      • Desserts

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • 1.5lbs beets (3-5, 1.5lbs)
    • arugula (5oz, 5c)
    • radishes (4, medium)
    • green onion (.33c)
  • Dairy
    • goat cheese (4oz)
  • Middle
    • pistachios (.33c, shelled/salted/toasted) or pepitas (.5c)
  • Staples
    • olive oil (.33c)
    • red wine vinegar (2tbsp)
    • honey (1tbsp)
    • Dijon mustard (1tbsp)
    • salt (.5tsp)
    • pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Scrub beets, slice off ends, slice into wedges
  2. Thinly slice radishes.
  3. Chop green onion
  4. Big bowl:
    • arugula (5oz, 5c)
    • pistachios (.33c) or pepitas (.5c)
    • goat cheese (4oz) crumbled
    • green onion (.33c)
  5. Whisk dressing
    • olive oil (.25c)
    • red wine vinegar (2tbsp)
    • honey (1tbsp)
    • Dijon mustard (1tbsp)
    • salt (.5tsp)
    • pepper

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 375
  2. Beets to baking sheet, toss with oil and salt, roast 35-40m
  3. Add beets to salad
  4. Toss with dressing

docs.title: Notes

    • Cook: 40m
  • Servings: 4-6

docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Onion (2)
    • Mushrooms
    • Garlic cloves (2)
    • Cilantro (1/4 c)
  • Middle
    • Black beans (30 oz)
    • Hamburger buns
  • Dairy
    • Eggs (2)
    • Pepper jack cheese slices
  • Staples
    • Pickles
    • Ketchup (2 tbsp)
    • Worcestershire sauce (2 tsp)
    • Hot sauce (1/2 tsp)
    • BBQ sauce (2 tbsp)
    • Salt (3/4 tsp)
    • Black pepper (1/2 tsp)
    • Cumin (1 tsp)
    • Chili powder (1 tsp)
    • Smoked paprika (1 tsp)
    • Breadcrumbs (1/2 c)
    • Olive oil (1 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Drain and rinse black beans.
  2. Carmelize 1 onion
  3. Prep pan fry mushrooms
  4. Aromatics
    • Finely chop 1 onion
    • Press 2 garlic cloves
  5. Bowl, mix
    • 2 eggs
    • 2 tbsp ketchup
    • 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
    • 1/2 tsp hot sauce
    • 2 tbsp BBQ sauce
    • 3/4 tsp salt
    • 1/2 tsp black pepper
    • 1 tsp cumin
    • 1 tsp chili powder
    • 1 tsp smoked paprika
    • 1/2 c breadcrumbs

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 325
  2. Spread beans on sheet, bake 15m to dry
  3. For onion, garlic
    1. Pan fry until softened, 5-6m.
    2. Blot dry
    3. Add to bowl
  4. Form the into 6 patties.
  5. Oven to 400
  6. Bake for 10 minutes on each side.
  7. Add Cheese, continue bake
  8. Serve

docs.title: Notes

docs.text: Inspried by Sally's Baking Addiction.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • yellow onions (2)
    • garlic (6)
    • broccoli with stalks (2lbs, 3-4)
    • large russet potato (12oz, 1)
    • green onions (opt)
  • Dairy
    • cheddar sharp (4-8oz)
  • Middle (none)
  • Staples
    • butter unsalted (3tbsp)
    • red pepper flakes (.5tsp)
    • sea salt (1.25tsp)
    • black pepper
    • water (6c)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
• Bowl: aromatics and spices
    • Onion (2): coarse chop
    • Garlic (6): press
    • red pepper flakes (.5tsp)
    • sea salt (1.25tsp)
    • black pepper (10 twists)
  • Broc
    • Slice off florettes, dice up
    • Chop off stalks, peel, cut 1in pieces
  • Measure 6c water + 1tsp salt
  • Potato (1): Cut 1in chunks
  • Cheddar (4-8oz): Grate
  • Slice green onion

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Soup pot, med-low heat. Melt butter
  2. Add aromatics and spices
  3. Cook, stir occasionally 8-10m
  4. Add
    • stalks
    • potato
    • 6c water, 1tsp salt
  5. Bring to boil, reduce med-low
  6. Cover and let simmer 20-25m
  7. Add half florets, stir, cover, cook until bright green (3-5m)
  8. Transfer to blender in batches, blend
  9. Return to pot, add rest florets, stir, cover, cook (4-7m)
  10. Add 4oz cheese
  11. Garnish with cheese and green onion

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Broccoli (2 heads)
    • Yellow onion (1)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Fresh thyme (1 tbsp)
  • Dairy
    • Unsalted butter (6 tbsp)
    • Milk (1.5 c)
    • Cheddar cheese (8 oz)
  • Middle
    • Sun dried tomatoes (opt)
    • Seitan bacon (opt)
    • Quinoa (1.5c)
    • Broth (3 c)
  • Staples
    • All-purpose flour (.25 c)
    • Panko breadcrumbs (1 c)
    • Nutmeg (.25 tsp)
    • Red pepper flakes (.25 tsp)
    • Olive oil (2 tbsp)
    • Salt and pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Start quinoa before prep. Start onions next. 2 person job.

  1. Quinoa
    • Rinse 1.5 c quinoa
    • Add 3c broth or water
    • Rice cooker, quick setting
  2. Onion (1)
    • Slice thin
    • Medium heat, 2 tbsp butter or olive oil
    • Stir every 3m at first, then more often once edges start browning
    • Cook until deeply caramelized and starting to crisp at edges (20-30m)
  3. Broccoli
    • Bite-sized florets
    • Olive oil (2 tbsp)
    • Salt
    • Single layer
  4. Panko (1 c)
    • butter (1 tbsp)
    • garlic (1), press
  5. Fixins
    • Sun dried tomatoes (opt)
    • Seitan bacon (opt)
    • Onion (1), caramelized
  6. Grate cheese (8 oz, 2.5 c)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Oven 400°F.
  2. Roast broccoli 20m
  3. Breadcrumbs (1c panko) medium heat, 2-3m
    • Butter (1 tbsp), garlic (1)
    • Toss until browned and crisp
  4. Add to quinoa
    • Caramelized onion (1)
    • Sun dried tomatoes (opt)
    • Seitan bacon (opt)
    • Salt, pepper, red pepper flakes (.25 tbsp)
    • All except .75c cheese
  5. In 9x9 baking dish
    • Cheesy quinoa
    • Breadcrumbs
  6. Reduce oven 350, Bake 25m

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • cauliflower (1, 2lbs)
    • red onion (1)
    • garlic (2)
    • lemon juice (1tbsp)
    • parsley, chives and/or green onions (2tbsp, opt)
  • Dairy
    • unsalted butter (2tbsp)
  • Middle
    • vegetable broth (32oz)
  • Staples
    • salt
    • nutmeg (.25tsp)
    • extra-virgin olive oil (3tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Cauli (2lbs) into bite-size florets - to lined baking sheet
  2. Chop red onion (1)
  3. Press garlic (2)
  4. Chop garnish green (2tbsp, opt)
  5. Juice lemon (1tbsp)
  6. Set aside
    • veg broth (32oz)
    • unsalted butter (2tbsp)
    • nutmeg (.25tsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 425F
    1. Toss cauli with 2tbsp olive oil
    2. Bake 25-35m, tossing halfway
  2. Soup pot with olive oil (1tbsp) over medium heat
    1. Add onion (1) and salt (.25tsp)
    2. Cook stirring occasionally (5-7m)
    3. Add garlic (2), cook stirring constantly (30s)
    4. Add broth (32oz)
    5. Add cauli (minus 4 garnish florets)
    6. Increase heat to medium-high, simmer
    7. Reduce heat to maintain simmer
    8. Stirring occasionally, cook (20m)
    9. Let cool (5m)
  3. To blender
    1. Add butter (2tbsp)
    2. Blend until smooth
    3. Add lemon juice (1tbsp) and nutmeg (.25tsp)
    4. Blend again, salt/lemon juice to taste
  4. Serve with garnish

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • red onion (.5)
    • garlic (4)
    • brussels sprouts (1c)
    • kale (1)
  • Dairy
    • sharp cheddar (4oz)
    • plain yogurt
  • Middle
    • chickpea flour (.5c)
  • Staples
    • olive oil (4tbsp)
    • Kosher salt
    • hot sauce

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Derib kale
  2. Thinly slice
    • kale (1)
    • brussels sprouts (1c)
    • red onion (.5)
  3. Press garlic (4)
  4. Grate sharp cheddar (4oz)
  5. Set aside
    • chickpea flour (.5c)
    • plain yogurt
    • hot sauce
  6. Small bowl, whisk
    • chickpea flour (.5c)
    • .5c plus 2 Tbsp. cold water
    • let sit 10m-1h

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
NOTE: Always spray pan first

  1. Oven to 350°
  2. Skillet, medium-high, 2 Tbsp. olive oil
    1. Add onion, garlic, brussels sprouts (3m)
    2. Add kale (3m)
    3. Add hot sauce (2tsp), salt, toss
    4. Transfer to medium bowl, wipe out skillet
  3. Skillet, medium-high, 1 tsp. olive oil
    1. Add batter (.25c), swirl to form thin 6" pancake (2m)
    2. Cook until well browned, crispy edges (2m)
    3. Flip, cook until lightly browned (1m)
    4. Transfer to rimmed baking sheet
    5. Repeat (4 total)
  4. Prep pancakes
    1. Divide vegetables between 2 pancakes
    2. Top with cheese, remaining 2 pancakes
    3. Bake until cheese is melted (6-8m)
  5. Serve topped with yogurt, hot sauce

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Servings: 2

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Kale (8 oz)
  • Dairy
    • Sour Cream (4 tbsp)
  • Middle
    • Chicken Breast Strips (20 oz)
    • Tomato Paste (3 oz)
    • Coconut Milk (11 oz)
  • Staples
    • Basmati Rice (1 c)
    • Curry Powder (2 tbsp)
    • Paprika (2 teaspoons)
    • Chili Flakes (2 teaspoons)
    • Salt
    • Pepper
    • Vegetable Oil (2 tbsp)
    • Sugar (4 teaspoons)
    • Butter (2 tbsp)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cook 1c rice in a rice cooker.
  2. Kale: Wash, dry, derib.
  3. Chicken: Pat dry, season with salt and pepper.
  4. Measure Sour Cream (4 tbsp)
  5. Wet bowl:
    • Open coconut milk.
    • Sugar (4 teaspoons)
    • Butter (2 tbsp)
  6. Measure out spices.
    • Tomato Paste (3 oz)
    • Curry Powder (2 tbsp)
    • Paprika (2 teaspoons)
    • Chili Flakes (2 teaspoons)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Large pan, med-high heat.
    1. Add kale and season with salt and pepper.
    2. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender (5-7 min).
    3. Transfer to a plate.
  2. Same pan, med-high heat. Add chicken, til browned (4-6 min).
  3. Same pan, med heat.
    1. Add tomato paste, curry powder, paprika, spices.
    2. Cook, stirring, until chicken coated and spices are fragrant (1 min).
    3. Add coconut milk, .25 cup water, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 tablespoon butter,
  4. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low (2-3 min)
  5. Add kale and sour cream (4 tbsp); stir to combine.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 25m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by HelloFresh.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Eggs (2)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Green onion (1)
    • Kale (1)
    • Lime (1)
    • Edamame (opt)
  • Dairy (none)
  • Middle (none)
  • Staples
    • high heat oil (2 tbsp)
    • misc chopped veg (opt)
    • sea salt
    • coconut flakes (.75 c)
    • brown rice (2 c)
    • soy sauce (2 tsp)
    • sriracha (2 tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Cook rice ahead of time

  1. Cook/chill 2 cups brown rice
  2. Derib and chop kale
  3. Measure 3/4 cup coconut flakes
  4. Bowl: Wisk 2 eggs, dash salt
  5. Bowl aromatics
    1. Press 2 garlic
    2. Chop 3/4 cup green onion
    3. Chop 1 cup veg (opt)
  6. Bowl sauce
    1. Soy sauce (2 tsp)
    2. Sriacha (2 tsp)
    3. Juice of 1/2 lime

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Large pan
    • Med-high heat until water sizzles
    • 1 tsp oil
    • Pour in the eggs, stir frequently, scrambled and lightly set
    • Eggs to bowl
    • Wipe pan
  2. Same pan - 1 tbsp oil
    • Add galic/green onion, optional veg
    • Cook until fragrant or veg tender, stir frequently, 30s+
    • Add kale and dash salt, cook 1-2m unil tender
    • Transfer to bowl of eggs
  3. Same pan - 2 tsp oil
    • Add coconut flakes, cook until lightly golden, 30s+
    • Add rice, cook until hot, 3m
    • Pour bowl back into pan, break up eggs
    • Once warmed, remove from heat
  4. Same pan
    • Add soy, sriracha, lime juice
    • Stir to combine
    • Taste, add tamari or salt as needed
  5. Garnish with lime wedges, serve

• Produce

  • Dairy
    • eggs (2)
  • Middle
    • sweetened shredded coconut (1c)
    • raw shrimp, peeled/deveined/with tails (1lb)
  • Staples
    • flour (0.33c)
    • salt (0.5tsp)
    • pepper (0.5tsp)
    • Panko (3/4c)
    • oil (3–4tbsp)
    • Soy sauce (1tbsp)
    • Rice vinegar (1tbsp)
    • Thai chili sauce (3tbsp,opt)
    • jam (6tbsp,opt)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Start rice

  1. Set up dredging
    • Flour (.33c), salt (.5tsp), pepper (.5tsp)
    • Beat eggs (2)
    • Panko (.75c), coconut (1c)
  2. Prep bok choy
  3. Mix dipping sauce
    • Thai chili sauce (3tbsp,opt)
    • Jam (6tbsp,opt)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Shrimp:
    1. Batter shrimp: flour -> egg -> panko
    2. Oil in large skillet, med heat
    3. Fry batches 7-8
    4. Fry each side 2.5-3min
    5. Plate on paper towel
  2. Bok choy:
    1. Oil in large skillet, med heat
    2. Add bok choy, cook 2min
    3. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar (2m)

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • orange (1tbsp)
    • green onion (1)
    • carrots (.5c)
    • cucumber (.5c)
    • bean sprouts (.5c)
    • garlic (2)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
    • noodles (8oz, 250g)
    • Toasted sesame seeds
    • Crushed peanuts
    • Chinese sesame paste (1tsp)
    • Peanut butter (2tbsp)
  • Staples

    • sesame oil (1tbsp)
    • canola oil (1tbsp)
    • Soy sauce (1tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Cut veg
    1. Green onion (1), julienne
    2. Cucumber (.5c), julienne
    3. Carrots (.5c), shred
  2. Mix sauce
    1. orange (1tbsp), juice
    2. garlic (2), press
    3. Peanut butter (2tbsp)
    4. Chinese sesame paste (1tsp)
    5. salt (0.5tsp)
    6. sesame oil (1tbsp)
    7. canola oil (1tbsp)
    8. Soy sauce (1tbsp)
    9. rice wine vinegar (2tbsp)
    10. Pasta water (3tbsp)
  3. Set aside
    1. Noodles (250g)
    2. Bean sprouts (.5c)
    3. Toasted sesame seeds
    4. Crushed peanuts

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
NOTE: Reserve pasta water (3tbsp)

  1. Noodles
    1. Cook the noodles al dente, reserve water (3tbsp)
    2. Rinse with cold water and drain
  2. Bean sprouts
    1. Blanch boiling water for 15s
    2. Ice bath
    3. Drain
  3. Big bowl
    1. Noodles
    2. Sauce
    3. Veg
    4. Crushed peanuts
    5. Toasted sesame seeds

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • sweet corn (8ears, 6c frozen)
    • red potatoes (1lbs)
    • red onion (1)
    • poblano pepper (1, opt)
    • red bell pepper (1)
    • celery ribs (2)
    • garlic (2)
    • lime (1)
  • Dairy
    • crème fraîche, sour cream, Greek yogurt (0.25c)
  • Middle
    • vegetable broth (32oz)
  • Staples
    • olive oil (1tbsp)
    • salt (0.75tsp)
    • chili powder (0.5tsp)
    • bay leaf (1)
    • unsalted butter (2tbsp)
    • pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Bowl A
    1. Corn. If fresh, shuck. If frozen, 6c
    2. Potatoes. Cut into.75” cubes (about 3c)
    3. Red onion (1), chop
    4. Poblano pepper, chop, de-seed, de-rib
    5. Celery (2), chop
    6. Bell pepper (1), chop
    7. salt (0.5tsp)
    8. Chili powder (0.5tsp)
  2. Garlic (2), press
  3. Set aside liquids
    1. Vegetable broth (32oz)
    2. Water (2c)
    3. Bay leaf (1)
  4. Butter (2tbsp), cut into 4 pieces
  5. Lime (1) juice (1tbsp)
  6. Garnishes
    1. Cheddar, grate
    2. Green onion, chop

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
NOTE: If greek yogurt or sour cream, temper by adding splashes of hot before mixing in.

  1. Large pot, med-heat, add
    1. Olive oil (1tbsp)
    2. Bowl A: corn, potatoes, etc.
  2. Stir, cook until onions are tender, 7-10min
  3. Add garlic, cook until fragrant, 30s-1min
  4. Add broth (32oz), water (2c), bay leaf (1)
  5. Bring to boil, reduce simmer, stir occasionally, 20-25min
  6. Check potatoes fork tender
  7. Remove bay leaf
  8. Blender
    1. Transfer 3c (half liquid, half solids)
    2. Add butter (2tbsp)
  9. Return to pot, add ...
    1. Tempered cream (0.25c)
    2. Lime juice (1tbsp)
    3. Salt/pepper

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • eggplant (2)
    • fresh basil (.25c)
    • fresh oragano (2tbsp)
  • Dairy
    • eggs (2)
    • fresh ricotta (400g)
    • parmesan (.33c)
    • mozzarella (1c)
  • Middle
    • tomato pasta sauce (1c)
    • pine nuts (.33c, opt)
  • Staples
    • oil spray

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
Note: Original recipe says to cut eggplant into 6 slices, we go thinner.

  1. Trim eggplant, slice thin
  2. Bowl
    1. Grated Parmesan (.33c)
    2. Beatten eggs (2)
    3. Fresh ricotta (400g)
    4. Chopped basil (.25c)
    5. Chopped oragano (2tbsp)
  3. Grate Mozzarella (1c)
  4. Set out
    • tomato pasta sauce (1c)
    • pine nuts (.33c)
  5. Spray muffin pan

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 410
  2. Eggplant
    1. Spray both sides with oil
    2. Fry in batches (3-4min each side)
    3. Set aside to cool (5min)
  3. Muffin pan
    1. Cut each eggplant slice in half
    2. Line pan with slices
    3. Scoop ricotta mixture into each cup
    4. Add pasta sauce, mozzarella, pine nuts
  4. Bake (20-25m)
  5. Let rest (10m)

docs.title: Prep

  2. Cut butternut squash (1, 2+lbs) into .75-inch cubes
  3. Derib kale
  4. Chop green onion (2, .75c)

  6. Mix dressing
    • olive oil (.25c)

    • salt (.25tsp)
    • cinnamon (.25tsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:

  2. Toast pepitas medium heat (3-5m)
    1. 1tsp olive oil
    2. .25tsp salt
    3. .25tsp cinnamon
  3. When rice done and warm, add
    1. kale (4oz)
    2. half green onion (.3c)
    3. dressing

    1. rice mixture
    2. butternut squash
    3. goat cheese (4oz)
    4. pomegranate (1)
    5. pepitas (.5c)
    6. green onion (.3c)

  • Dairy

    • pasta
  • Staples

    • pepper (0.75tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Dice onion (1)
  2. Juice lemon (1)
  3. Soak cashews (0.5c+) - depends on blender
  4. Set aside
    1. Garlic (4) pressed
    2. Vegetable broth (1.5c)
    3. Nutritional yeast (2tbsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. If using raw cashews with weak blender, soak overnight
  2. Large pan over medium to medium-high heat
    1. Add onion (1) and 1c broth
    2. Cook 8m until tender - more broth if cooking too fast
    3. Cook until broth is gone
    4. Add garlic (4) and cook 2m
  3. Add to blender
    1. Pan contents
    2. 0.5c broth - more later if needed
    3. Salt (0.75tsp)
    4. Pepper (0.75tsp)
    5. Cashews (0.5c+)
    6. Lemon juice (1tbsp)
    7. Nutritional yeast (2tbsp)
  4. Blend on high until smooth. Add if needed ...
    1. Broth
    2. Salt, pepper, lemon juice
    3. Nutritional yeast
  5. Serve over pasta cooked with salted water

  • Staples

    • Bay leaves (2)

    • Salt (1.5tsp)
    • White pepper (1tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Chop .5 onion
  2. Chop green onion (1, opt)
  3. Open coconut milk
  4. Rinse beans
  5. Measure rice, long grain (2c)
  6. Spice mix A
    • Fresh thyme (1, or 1tsp dry)
    • Garlic (2), pressed
    • Bay leaves (2)
  7. Spice mix B
    • Paprika (1tsp, opt)
    • White pepper (1tsp)
    • Jerk seasoning (1.5tsp)
    • Salt (1.5tsp)
    • Bouillon (1.5tsp, opt)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 350
  2. Prep chicken
    1. Wash, pat dry, .5in slits
    2. Season with salt (1.5tsp), bouillon, jerk seasoning
  3. Oven-safe skillet, med-high heat, oil (2tbsp)
    1. Chicken, skin side up, 3min
    2. Flip, 3min
    3. Remove chicken, wipe pan
  4. Same skillet, oil (2tbsp)
    1. Onions, thyme, garlic, bay leaf, sauté 2-3min
    2. Add rice (2c), beans
    3. Add all remaining ingredients
      • Chicken stock (2c) or water
      • Coconut milk (13.5oz)
      • Spice mix B: paprika, white pepper, jerk seasoning, salt, bouillon
  5. Pan to oven, 30-35min, uncovered
  6. Garnish with green onions

  • Dairy

    • dried thyme (0.5tsp)

    • red pepper flakes (Pinch)
    • pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Chop into bowl
    1. Onion (1)
    2. Carrots (2), peel
  2. Spices into bowl
    1. Garlic (4), press
    2. ground cumin (2tsp)
    3. curry powder (1tsp)
    4. dried thyme (0.5tsp)
  3. Kale (1c), derib
  4. Open tomatoes (28oz) and 'lightly' drain
  5. Lintils (1c), picked over and rinsed
  6. Juice lemon (1, 1.5tbsp)
  7. Measure water (2c)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Pot over medium heat, add olive oil (0.25c)
  2. Once shimmering, add onion and carrot, stir often (5m)
  3. Add
    1. Garlic, cumin, curry powder and thyme, cook (30s)
    2. Lentils, broth (4c) and water (2c)
    3. Salt (1tsp), pinch red pepper flakes, pepper
  4. Bring to boil
  5. Partially cover and reduce heat to maintain simmer (25-30m)
  6. Transfer 2c to blender, purée until smooth, return to pot
  7. Add kale, cook (5m)
  8. Remove from heat
    1. Add lemon juice (1.5tbsp)
    2. Optional salt/pepper/red pepper flakes

    • flour (0.33c)
    • panko crumbs (1.5c)
    • paprika, smoked (0.25tsp)
    • salt and pepper to taste

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Grate heddar (4c) + gruyere (2c)
  2. Combine topping
    1. panko (1.5c)
    2. parmesan (0.5c), grated
    3. paprika (0.25tsp)
    4. butter (4tbsp) - melted
  3. Grease baking dish (3-4qt)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 350
  2. Cook pasta
    1. 1min shy of al dente
    2. Coat olive oil to prevent sticking
  3. Make roux in pot, med heat
    1. Melt butter (6tbsp) in saucepan
    2. Whisk in flour (0.33c) 1m until bubbly and golden
    3. Gradually whisk in milk (3c) and heavy cream (1c) until smooth
    4. Whisk until bubbles on surface, then 2m
    5. Salt and pepper
  4. Add cheese
    1. Cheddar, gruyere cheese in two 2c increments
    2. Whisk until smooth
    3. Add cooked pasta
  5. Layer in baking dish
    1. Half mac and cheese
    2. 2c shredded cheese
    3. Remaining mac and cheese
    4. Topping
  6. Bake 30m

docs.text:

    • broccoli (2)
    • edamame beans (8tbsp)
    • garlic (2)
    • lemon (2)
    • mint (10g)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
    • cashews (70g)
    • miso paste (2tbsp)
    • smoked tofu (300g)
    • soba noodles (400g)
  • Staples
    • Dijon mustard (1tsp)
    • Sriracha (4tsp)
    • mirin (4tbsp)
    • pepper
    • red chili pepper (2)
    • rice syrup or maple (2tbsp)
    • salt
    • sesame oil, toasted (4tbsp)
    • sesame seeds (opt)
    • soy sauce (8tbsp)
    • tahini (4tbsp)
    • vegetable oil

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Mix miso tofu marinade - difficult to mix, use a wisk or blender
    1. miso paste (2tbsp)
    2. red chili pepper (2)
    3. garlic (2), press
    4. sesame oil, toasted (4tbsp)
  2. Mix tahini sauce
    1. tahini (4tbsp)
    2. rice syrup or maple (2tbsp)
    3. mirin (4tbsp)
    4. lemon juice (2 whole lemons)
    5. Dijon mustard (1tsp)
    6. Sriracha (4tsp)
    7. soy sauce (8tbsp)
  3. Measure bowl
    1. cashews (70g)
    2. edamame beans (8tbsp)
  4. Measure mint (10g)
  5. Chop, keep separate
    1. broccoli (2) into small florets
    2. bok choy (4), separate leaves from stalks
    3. tofu (300g) into cubes

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Add tofu to miso marinade, mix well, set aside
  2. Wok
    1. Fry broccoli 5m
    2. Bok choy stalks 3m
    3. Edamame beans, cashews, tofu 3m
    4. Bok choy leaves, mint, tahini sauce, mix well
  3. Cook noodles 3m
  4. Add noodles to wok, mix well
  5. Serve, top with sesame seeds

    • Bay leaves (2)
    • Cumin (1tbsp)

    • pepper
    • Water (5c)
  • Measure rice (1c)
  • Mearure lentils (1c)

    • green onions (.5c)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text: Big pot for rice/lentils can be cooking while onions are caramelizing.

docs.title: Rice
docs.text:
1. Big pot to boil over med-high heat
    • Garlic (4) whole
    • Bay leaves (2)
    • Cumin (1tbsp)
    • Salt (1.5tsp)
    • pepper
    • Water (5c)
  2. After boil, add rice (1c), cover, and reduce to med heat (10m)
  3. Add lentils (1c), cover, and simmer (20-23m)
  4. Drain excess water, return to pot, and cover with towel (10m)
  5. Discard bay leaves
  6. Smash garlic against side of pot with fork
  7. Add half green onions and half parsley

docs.title: Onions
docs.text:
1. Separate 12in pan to medium-high heat until onion sizzles on contact
  2. Add
    • Olive oil (.33c)
    • Onions (2)
  3. Stir every 3m at first, then more often once edges start browning
  4. Cook until deeply caramelized and starting to crisp at edges (20-30m)
  5. Transfer to paper towel lined plate
  6. Sprinkle salt (0.25tsp)

docs.title: Serve
docs.text:
1. Combine rice/lentils and onions
  2. Garnish w/ remaining green onions and parsley
  3. Serve w/ yogurt and spicy sauce

  2. Dice onion (1), celery (1c), carrots (1c)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:

  2. Oven-safe skillet, med-high, melt butter (4tbsp)
    1. Saute onion, celery, carrot, until translucent 3-5m
    2. Sprinkle flour (0.25c), stir to coat, cook 1-2m

    4. Stir, reduce until most liquid gone
    5. Add broth (1.5c), stir

    7. Fold in chicken, peas (0.5c)
    8. Simmer on low until thickened, 5m
    9. Salt and pepper to taste
    10. Opt: to pie pan
  3. Bake
    1. Puff pastry, cover, tuck in
    2. Cut slits
    3. Bake 35-45m, golden brown, bubbly

docs.text:

  2. Prepare vegetables on sheet
    • cherry tomatoes

docs.text:

    2. Roast for 25m at 400°F.
  2. Pasta:
    1. Cook pasta until al dente. Reserve 1c pasta water.
    2. Drain pasta and return to the pot.
  3. Combine in pot:
    1. Add bowl w/ lemon juice, butter, goat cheese, etc.
    2. Add .25c pasta water - or more
    3. Add roasted veg and juices to the pot.
    4. Toss to combine.
    5. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with basil.

docs.title: Szechuan Eggplant
docs.text: NOTE: Recipe written with eggplant in mind, but works well with tofu and green beans.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Japanese Eggplant (1.5lbs)
    • garlic (4)
    • ginger (2tsp)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
  • Staples
    • salt (2tsp)
    • cornstarch (2tbsp)
    • peanut oil (2–4tbsp)
    • dried red chilies (5–10)
    • Szechuan peppercorns (1tsp)
    • soy sauce (0.25c)
    • garlic chili paste (1tbsp)
    • sesame oil (1tbsp)
    • rice vinegar (1tbsp)
    • mirin (1tbsp)
    • sugar or alternative (3tbsp)
    • five spice (0.5tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Rice cooker (2c)
  2. Eggplant wet
    1. cut into 0.5 inch thick half-moons
    2. Into bowl water with salt (2tsp)
    3. Cover, brine 20-30m
  3. Aromatics bowl
    1. Grate ginger (1tsp)
    2. Garlic (4), press
  4. Set aside dried chilis (5-10)
  5. Szchuan peppercorns (1tsp), toast (1-2m), crush
  6. Mix sauce, whisk
    1. Peppercorns (1tsp)
    2. Soy sauce (0.25c)
    3. Garlic chili paste (1tbsp)
    4. Sesame oil (1tbsp)
    5. Rice vinegar (1tbsp)
    6. Mirin (1tbsp)
    7. Sugar or alternative (3tbsp)
    8. Five spice (0.5tsp)
  7. Eggplant dry
    1. Drain, rinse, pat dry
    2. Toss with cornstarch (2tbsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Large skillet, medium heat, oil (1-2tbsp) (2 batches)
    1. Eggplant, brown (10m)
    2. Flip, brown (10m)
    3. Set aside
  2. Large skillet, medium heat, oil (1tbsp)
    1. Garlic (4), ginger (1tsp), stir (2m)
    2. Dried chilis (5-10), stir (1m)
    3. Sauce, simmer (20s)
    4. Eggplant, toss (1m)
    5. Water (1tbsp), if dry

docs.text:

  2. Cut carrots (3), in half, not peel
  3. Mix salmon brine
    1. hot water (0.75c)
    2. nori powder (1tbsp)
    3. caper brine (3tbsp)
    4. rice vinegar (2tbsp)
    5. miso paste (1tbsp)
    6. soy sauce (3tbsp)
    7. lemon juice (1tsp)
    8. garlic powder (1tsp)
    9. olive oil (.25c)

docs.title: Tuna prep
docs.text:
1. Watermelon (1)
    1. Cut 1" thick slabs
    2. Sprinkle with salt
    3. Let sit 30m
  2. Blend marinade
    1. flaxseed oil (2tbsp)
    2. rice vinegar (2tbsp)
    3. white miso paste (2tbsp)
    4. soy sauce (0.25c)
    5. toasted sesame oil (2tbsp)
    6. lime juice (1tbsp)
    7. lime zest (1tbsp)
    8. fresh ginger, peeled (25g)
    9. green onions (2)
    10. garlic (1)
    11. chili powder (0.5tsp)
    12. wakame flakes (2tbsp)
    13. beetroot powder (2tbsp)
    14. paprika powder (1tsp)
    15. water (0.25c)
    16. salt

docs.title: Salmon cook
docs.text:
1. Boil carrots (3)
    1. Salted water (1tsp) 5-10m, fork tender, not mushy
    2. Shock in ice water
    3. Cool 2m, drip dry on wire rack
  2. Slice carrots lengthwise
  3. Place in marinade overnight

docs.title: Tuna cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 356
  2. Bake watermelon (1) 65m
  3. Remove from oven, will be lot of water, let cool
  4. Place slabs in marinade overnight, air-tight container
  5. Next day, sear in oiled skillet, high heat, 2-4m each side
  6. Let cool slide into strips

docs.title: Sushi rice
docs.text:
1. Rinse rice (2c) until water clear
  2. Soak cold water 20m
  3. Drain and rinse again
  4. Combine rice (2c) with 3c water in rice cooker
  5. Set to sushi setting
  6. In small bowl
    1. Rice vinegar (.33c) and sugar (.33c),
    2. Microwave 30s, stir
    3. Pour over cooked rice, mix well

docs.title: Serving
docs.text:
1. Wet both hands
  2. Roll
    1. Place plastic-wrap on the sushi mat
    2. Lay (half) sheet nori, shiny side down
    3. Spread rice with wooden spoon
    4. Cover with 1cm layer, leave edge clear
    5. Add toppings, roll
    6. To cut, wet knife
  3. Nigiri
    1. Take rice (3tbsp) and squeeze into a log
    2. Drape slice over top

docs.text:

    • flour (3 tbsp)
    • ground chili powder (1 tbsp)
    • ground cumin (1 tsp)
    • garlic powder (0.5 tsp)
    • dried oregano (0.25 tsp)
    • salt/pepper
  2. Measure? Sauce wet. Place near stove, separate.
    • tomato paste (2 tbsp)
    • vegetable broth (2 c)

docs.title: Enchilada
docs.text:
1. Preheat 400, middle rack
  2. Grease 9x13 pan, w/ tortillas nearby
  3. Chop red onion (1 c)
  4. Chop same bowl: broc florettes (1), red bell pepper (1)
  5. Small dry:
    • cumin (1 tsp)
    • cinnamon (.25 tsp)
  6. Measure 5c spinach packed
  7. Shred cheese (1 c)
  8. Mixing bowl
    • Drained black beans
    • Cheese (.25 c)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Sauce:
    1. Warm oil in a pot over medium heat.
    2. Add flour/spices when sizzle on contact
    3. Whisk constantly for 1m until fragrant.
    4. Whisk in 2 tbsp tomato paste, then slowly pour in 2c broth.
    5. Heat to med-high, then gentle simmer 5-7m until thickened.
    6. Season salt/pepper
  2. Large skillet on medium w/ olive oil (2 tbsp)
    1. Cook onion 5-7m until translucent
    2. Add broc/bell pepper, 3-5m until tender
    3. Recuce to medium-low, cover, stir 8-9m until brown edges
    4. Add cumin/cinnamon, cook 30s
    5. Add spinach by handful, stir until wilted
    6. To bowl w/ beans/cheese
  3. Bowl: 2 tbsp sauce, stir
  4. Pan: 0.5 c sauce
  5. Assemble:
    1. Fill tortilla w/ .5c veg, roll, and place seam side down
    2. Drizzle remaining sauce/cheese.
  6. Bake 20 min mid rack
  7. Bake 3-6 min upper rack
  8. Rest 10 min

  • Halve eggplants, bruch with olive oil, cut side down on sheet

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Bake eggplant until tender, 35-40m
  2. Set aside to cool
  3. Flip, scoop out flesh, discard skin
  4. Mesh strainer over bowl, transfer flesh, discard skin
  5. Let rest, shake/stir to release moisture
  6. Discard liquid, wipe out
  7. Dump eggplant into food processor
  8. Add
    • tahini (.25c)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Lemon juice (2tbsp)
  9. Slow drizzle in olive oil (.33c)
  10. Stir in
    • Parsley (2tbsp)
    • salt (.75tsp)
    • ground cumin (.25tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Eggs (2), to room temperature
  2. Cherries (2c), pitted and halved
    1. If fresh cherries, rinse
    2. Coat in flour (1tbsp), sugar (1tbsp)
  3. Juice lemon (2tbsp)
  4. Spray 9x9 baking pan with non-stick spray

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 350
  2. Topping, combine
    1. Sugar (1c)
    2. Flour (.5c)
    3. Cinnamon (1tsp)
    4. Butter (4tbsp)
    5. Mix, cut to form coarse crumbs
  3. Glaze, combine, set aside
    1. Powdered sugar (1c)
    2. Milk (1.5tsp)
    3. Vanilla extract (1tsp)
  4. Combine wet, mix
    1. Eggs (2)
    2. Oil (.75c)
    3. Greek yogurt (.75c)
    4. Sugar (1c)
    5. Lemon juice (2tbsp)
  5. Comgine dry, mix
    1. Flour (2c)
    2. Baking powder (2tsp)
    3. Salt (.25tsp)
  6. Fold in cherries (2c), don't overmix
  7. Transfer to baking pan, sprinkle topping
  8. Bake 44-55min
  9. Cool 10min, drizzle glaze

docs.title: Oreo Pie
docs.text: NOTE: Calls for stand mixer and tart pan, but can be done without.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • butter (4tbsp)
    • cream cheese (8oz)
    • greek yogurt or sour cream (0.5c)
    • heavy cream (1.25c)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
    • Package of Oreos
    • white chocolate (1c)
    • semi-sweet chocolate (3oz)
    • powdered sugar (0.5c)
    • vanilla extract (1.5tsp)
  • Staples

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Oven to 350
  2. Smash oreo crumbs (2.5c) in a bag
  3. Soften cream cheese (8oz)
  4. Finely chop semi-sweet chocolate (3oz)
  5. Melt white chocolate (1c)
  6. Chop Oreos (8)
  7. Melt butter (4tbsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oreo Crust
    1. Mix oreo crumbs (2.5c) and melted butter (4tbsp) in a bowl.
    2. Press into pie pan
    3. In oven (10m)
  2. Filling
    1. Melt white chocolate (1c)
    2. Beat heavy cream (0.5c) until stiff peaks, set aside
    3. Beat cream cheese (8oz) until smooth, med high (2m)
    4. Add powdered sugar (0.5c), beat (1m)
    5. Add yogurt (0.5c), mix
    6. Add vanilla extract (1tsp) and melted white chocolate (1c), mix
    7. Add whipped cream and chopped Oreos, fold
    8. Pour into crust
    9. Refrigerate (4-6h)
  3. Ganache
    1. Heat cream (0.25c) until almost boiling in sauce pan or microwave (30s)
    2. Pour over chopped chocolate (3oz)
    3. Let stand (30s)
    4. Stir until melted
    5. If needed, microwave in 10s intervals, stirring in between
    6. Let cool (30m)
    7. Pour over filling
  4. Whipped Cream - Had excess last time
    1. Beat heavy cream (0.5c) and vanilla extract (0.5tsp) until stiff peaks
    2. Into piping bag
    3. Pipe on top of ganache

  • Middle

    • semi-sweet chocolate chips (1.5c, 270g)
  • Staples
    • flour (2c + 1tbsp, 258g)
    • oats, old-fashioned (1.5c, 128g)
    • unsalted butter (1c, 226g)
    • maple syrup (3tbsp, 45ml)
    • brown sugar (0.75c, 150g)
    • granulated sugar (0.25c, 50g)
    • baking soda (1tsp)
    • ground cinnamon (2tsp)
    • pumpkin pie spice* (2tsp)
    • salt (0.5tsp)
    • vanilla extract (2tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Eggs to room temperature
  2. Melt butter (1c), allow to cool
  3. Baking sheet, silicone mat
  4. Blot pumpkin puree (0.75c) with paper towel

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 350
  2. Mix dry
    1. flour (2c + 1tbsp, 258g)
    2. baking soda (1tsp)
    3. ground cinnamon (2tsp)
    4. pumpkin pie spice* (2tsp)
    5. salt (0.5tsp)
    6. oats, old-fashioned (1.5c, 128g)
  3. Mix wet, whisk
    1. melted butter (1c, 226g)
    2. maple syrup (3tbsp, 45ml)
    3. brown sugar, packed (0.75c, 150g)
    4. granulated sugar (0.25c, 50g)
    5. egg yolk (1)
    6. pumpkin puree (0.75c, 170g)
    7. vanilla extract (2tsp)
  4. Pour wet into dry, mix, add chocolate chips (1.5c, 270g)
  5. Scoop 1.5tbsp balls onto sheet, 3in apart. Flatten slightly.
  6. Bake 13-14m
  7. Cool 5m on sheet, transfer to rack to cool completely
